intro: Hypaelyptum senegalense, commonly known as the Senegalese hypaelyptum, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has been used traditionally in local medicine for its potential health benefits. Its ecological role includes soil stabilization and providing habitat for small animals.
